title: ADVISORY: Vice President Biden to Travel to New York to Highlight Progress of the Recovery Act | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House




July 07, 2009

 



ADVISORY: Vice President Biden to Travel to New York to Highlight Progress of the Recovery Act




THE WHITE HOUSE   Office of the Vice President  ----------------------------------------------------  FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE                                     July 7, 2009  Vice President Biden to Travel to New York to Highlight Progress of the Recovery Act   Washington, D.C. – On Thursday, July 9, Vice President Biden will travel to Saratoga County, NY, where he will highlight the progress of the Recovery Act at Shenendehowa High School.  The Vice President will discuss how the Recovery Act is building a 21st-century economy in Saratoga County and across the nation.  The Vice President will be joined at this event by New York Governor David A. Paterson and Congressman Scott Murphy. A limited number of general public tickets for the Vice President’s event in Saratoga County are available on a first-come, first-served basis on Wednesday, July 8 from 12:00 PM EDT - 1:00 PM EDT at Shenendehowa High School East in the main lobby area. Any remaining tickets will be distributed from 5:00 PM EDT - 7:00 PM EDT from the same location. This event is OPEN PRESS ,but media must RSVP to press@ovp.eop.gov by Wednesday, July 8, at 5:00 PM EDT. Media Details: Vice President Biden to travel to Saratoga County, NY, to highlight the progress of the Recovery Act           Date: Thursday, July 9, 2009 Location: Shenendehowa Central Schools - Main Campus  High School East Building - New Gymnasium  970 Route 146, Clifton Park, NY 12065  Moe Rd. Entrance  Press Entrance: High School East - Main Entrance  Sat Truck Parking:    Southwest corner of front parking lot, on paved area alongside building.  Press Parking:  High School East - Front Lot  Camera Pre-set:  9:45 AM EDT - 10:45 AM EDT                             Restricted Access:  10:45 AM EDT – 12:45 PM EDT  Press Arrival:  12:45 PM EDT  Final Press Access:   2:00 PM EDT  Event Begins:  2:30 PM EDT  Cable Run:   500 Feet  Throw:   50 Feet RSVP: This event is OPEN PRESS, but media must RSVP with the NAME, MEDIA OUTLET, PHONE AND EMAIL for each person planning to cover the event to press@ovp.eop.gov by Wednesday, July 8, at 5:00 PM EDT. At the event, you will be required to wear your media credential at all times, either around the neck or pinned to clothing. For logistical questions, please contact Tollef Biggs at 202.757.9081 or tollef@mac.com
